text:
I am working on the Ant integration for the Eclipse project.
It would help us out if the logging of the buildfile that currently occurs at 
line 502 in Main.processArgs(String[]) could be moved and be logged using a 
call to Project.log(String) in the appropriate location in Main.runBuild
(ClassLoader) after the build listeners and build loggers have been registered.

Thanks for your consideration.
creator: Darin_Swanson@us.ibm.com

text:
Just a note that you really should not be integrating Ant using the Main class -
it is really meant for command line use (manipulation of System.out|err|in, use
of System.exit, etc).
creator: conor@apache.org
Darin_Swanson@us.ibm.com
text:
For the "standard" Eclipse integration we do not use the "Main" entry point.

Eclipse supports running Ant within the same VM as Eclipse (no use of the Main 
class) and running Ant in a separate VM as a standard Java process (which 
results in the Main class being used). 

The change I am requesting is for the second use case.

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
I am trying to understand a little bit more what you're trying to achieve here.
Why is the current output into System.out a problem for you? 

If I move this to project.log it would have two consequences. One would be to
generate a log event prior to the buildStarted event for all of the listsners.
There are no strict guarantees there, IIRC, but it would certainly affect some
listeners. The XML logger, for example, would probably fail with a NPE accessing
buildElement which is constructed in the buildStarted event

The other consequence is that this particular output would be included in any
log file created with -logfile and nothing would appear on the console for
command line users. Not sure if that is something we should change.
ping, need info... is this still an issue, Darin?
